RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduação em Bacharelado Em Química pela Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul (1991) e doutorado em Química pela Universidade Federal de Santa Catarina (1997), com pós-doutorado na Università Degli Studi di Parma, trabalhando com o Prof. Roddo Ungaro. Atualmente é professor da Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul. Atua em química supramolecular, usando os calixarenos como plataforma sintética.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduate at Bacharelado Em Química from Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul (1991) and ph.d. at Chemistry from Universidade Federal de Santa Catarina (1997). Has experience in Chemistry, focusing on Organic Synthesis, acting on the following subjects: calixarenes, supramolecular chemistry, calixarenos, molecular recognition and química supramolecular.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES:
Participante da Rede de Nanotecnologia Molecular e de Interfaces ( RENAMI ), coordenada pelo Prof. Dr. Oscar Malta da (UFPR), na sub-rede de Química Supramolecular, encabeçada pelo Prof. Dr. Henrique Eisi Toma. Apoios financeiros recebidos:
Fundação Araucária - 10/2001 a 01-2003 - em andamento

ATUACAO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-INSTITUICAO: Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA: São sintetizados receptores moleculares usando calixarenos e outros macrociclos como pontos de partida para reconhecimento molecular e de metais em solução e fase sólida. Para o entendimento das forças que operam na formação dos complexos, são realizados estudos dinâmicos, determinação de constantes de complexação, seletividade e determinação estrutural usando raio-X de monocristal.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Chiral lactic acid and ethyl lactate p-tert-butylcalix[4]arene derivatives

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Journal of Chemical Society- Perkin Transactions 2

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O-Tosyl-S-ethyl lactate reacted with para-tert-butylcalix[4]arene in K2CO3/acetone with inversion of configuration on the asymmetric centre, and only the bis-substitution product in the distal oxygens was obtained. Further attempts to react the bis-lactate-para-tert-butylcalix[4]arene with BrCH2CO2CH3 under the same conditions failed to occur. The X-ray analysis of the lactate derivative shows two independent molecules in the unit cell; one CH3 of the ethyl radical is immersed in the cavity of the other molecule. Both adopt a slightly distorted cone conformation. NMR shows that carbons and hydrogens of the methylene bridges and meta positions are diastereotopic. Ester hydrolysis was carried out without racemization, and the diastereotopic behaviour of the lactic derivative was maintained .

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Calix[4]arene piperidinium salt

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The crystal structure of the pentacyclo[19.3.1.13,7.19,13.115,19]octacosa-1(25),3,5,7(28),9, 11,13(27),15,17,19(26),21,23-dodecaene-25-oxy-26,27,28-triol 1 and piperidinium, 2(C28H24O4-.C5H11N+).3H2O.CH3CN was determined. Two molecules of calix[4]arene, two molecules of piperidinium, three molecules of water and one molecule of acetonitrile are observed in the asymmetric unit, which form an intricate network of hydrogen bonds. The calixarene molecules have a cone conformation and the piperidinium cations are located at the rim of the cones. The hydrogens bound to the positive nitrogens are not directed towards the benzene rings, indicating that no N+-H - p interaction occurs.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Calixarenos - receptores para reconhecimento molecular

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Calixarenes are macrocycles obtained via phenol-aldehyde condensation. They exhibit interesting properties as low pKa values compared to the correponding phenols, conformational mobility, host-guest complexation with metals and neutral molecules and catalysis. These properties, together with synthesis and derivations, are reviewed.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Calixarenes N-Phtaloyl Aminoacids
Synthesis and Properties of Upper Rim C-Linked Peptidocalix[4]arenes

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Cone calix[4]arenes, functionalized with two or four l-alanine or l-phenylalanine units at the upper rim, have been synthe-sized. These compounds, in which the amino acids are at-tached to the calix[4]arene macrocycle through their carboxy groups, have been named C-linked peptidocalix[4]arenes. The solubility, conformational, and recognition properties of this novel class of chiral receptors are quite different from those previously reported for N-linked peptidocalix[4]arenes. The tetrafunctionalized phthaloyl derivatives 2 are soluble in low polarity media, whereas the corresponding acetyl and benzoyl derivatives 4 and 5 are completely insoluble in CDCl3 , suggesting a high degree of aggregation of the latter compounds. Protonation of the terminal amino groups of 3 results in positively charged water-soluble receptors, which represent the cationic counterparts of negatively charged, water-soluble, N-linked peptidocalix[4]arenes. The difunc-tionalized acetyl derivatives 9 are soluble in CDCl3 and show a pinched cone conformation, which is mainly determined by intramolecular hydrogen bonding, as revealed by solvent-dependent 1 H NMR spectra and molecular modelling. In contrast to the N-linked analogues, which complex ammo-nium cations and carboxylic acids, the newly synthesized C-linked peptidocalix[4]arenes interact preferentially with an-ionic species.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Interaction of Calix[4]arene and Aliphatic Amines: A Combined NMR, Spectrophotometric and Conductimetric Investigation

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Equilíbrios entre calixarenos e diversos compostos heterocíclicos nitrogenados ( piridinas, pirróis e imidazóis ) são estudados em diversos solventes e efeitos de estrutura e reatividade na complexação estão sendo avaliados.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A acadêmica Patrícia Los Weinert iniciou sua Iniciação Científica em 1999 e continua atualmente no grupo, sintetizando vários derivados de calixarenos com aminoácidos, álcoois e aminas, testando como complexantes de metais alcalinos.
